For each row in the table, look up the etymology of the word. In the "Derived" column, write Latin, Greek, Germanic, etc. In the "Etymology" column, fill in the corresponding word in Greek, Latin, or others, but leave blank if unknown.
| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | e | | | | il | | | | balzo | | | | via | | | | là | | | | oltra | | | | si | | | | dismontare | | |
query.result: | Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | e | Latin | *et* | | il | Latin | *ille* | | balzo | Latin | *balzare* (from Late Latin *balzare*, related to *balzare* “to leap”) | | via | Latin | *via* | | là | Latin | *illā* | | oltra | Latin | *ultra* | | si | Latin | *se* | | dismontare | Latin | *dis‑* + *montare* (from Latin *mons, montis* “mountain”) |
